identificationModule.briefTitle: Efficacy of Omega-3 Fatty Acid Therapy in Preventing Gastrointestinal Bleeding in Patients With CF-LVAD
identificationModule.officialTitle: Open-Label Prospective Randomized Control Trial to Investigate the Efficacy of Omega-3 Fatty Acid Therapy in Preventing Gastrointestinal Bleeding in Patients With Continuous-Flow Left Ventricular Assist Device

descriptionModule.briefSummary: This study evaluates the efficacy of high-dose fish oil in decreasing rates of gastrointestinal bleeding in patients with continuous-flow left ventricular assist devices. Half of the patients without history of bleeding will receive fish oil while the other half will not. Half of the patients with history of bleeding will receive fish oil while the other half will not. Markers of angiogenesis and inflammation, as well as changes in the microbiome will be assessed in each group.
descriptionModule.detailedDescription:
A potential mechanism of bleeding in patients with continuous-flow left ventricular assist devices (CF-LVAD) is dysfunctional angiogenesis. Angiogenesis is a complicated process controlled by several markers. Previous studies have shown that elevated Angiopoietin-2 and TNF-alpha are associated with bleeding events in CF-LVAD patients.

Fish oil has anti-inflammatory and potentially anti-angiogenic properties. A retrospective study of CF-LVAD patients on high-dose fish oil showed a marked decrease in gastrointestinal bleeding rates in these patients. Additionally, these patients had lower levels of circulating Angiopoietin-2. Fish oil is known to have an effect on the microbiome, and the aforementioned effects may be seen in changes of the microbiota.

armGroups.label: Primary Prevention Intervention
armGroups.description: In patients with CF-LVAD who have not had a gastrointestinal bleed, patients randomized to intervention will receive 4 grams of Nature Made Ultra Omega-3 Fish Oil once daily for 1 year along with standard of care.

armGroups.label: Primary Prevention Non-Intervention
armGroups.description: In patients with CF-LVAD who have not had a gastrointestinal bleed, patients randomized to placebo will receive no fish oil and only standard of care.

armGroups.label: Secondary Prevention Intervention
armGroups.description: In patients with CF-LVAD who have had a gastrointestinal bleed, patients randomized to intervention will receive 4 grams of Nature Made Ultra Omega-3 Fish Oil once daily for 1 year along with standard of care.

armGroups.label: Secondary Prevention Non-Intervention
armGroups.description: In patients with CF-LVAD who have had a gastrointestinal bleed, patients randomized to placebo will receive no fish oil and only standard of care.

interventions.name: Omega 3 fatty acids
interventions.description: Patients will receive 4 grams fish oil once daily

primaryOutcomes.measure: Change in Markers of Angiogenesis - Angiopoietin 1/2 and VEGF
primaryOutcomes.description: Markers of angiogenesis and inflammation will be measured on customized Luminex assay panels. These will include Angiopoietin-1 (ng/mL), Angiopoietin-2 (ng/mL), and VEGF (ng/mL).
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Markers will be measured at baseline at randomization, and at 3 months, 6 months, and 12 months after randomization.

primaryOutcomes.measure: Change in Markers of Angiogenesis - TNF-alpha
primaryOutcomes.description: Markers of angiogenesis and inflammation will be measured on customized Luminex assay panels. These will include TNF-alpha (pg/mL).
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Markers will be measured at baseline at randomization, and at 3 months, 6 months, and 12 months after randomization.

primaryOutcomes.measure: Change in Markers of Inflammation - C-Reactive Protein
primaryOutcomes.description: Markers of angiogenesis and inflammation will be measured on customized Luminex assay panels. These will include c-reactive protein (mg/dL).
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Markers will be measured at baseline at randomization, and at 3 months, 6 months, and 12 months after randomization.

secondaryOutcomes.description: Rates of Gastrointestinal Bleeding will be assessed.
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Rates of bleeding will be measured at 3 months, 6 months, and 12 months after randomization.

secondaryOutcomes.description: The microbiome will be assessed using rectal swabs. The swabs will be analyzed to determine the bacterial species present at each time point.
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: The microbiome will be assessed at baseline at randomization, and at 3 months, 6 months, and 12 months after randomization.

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

1. Subject has signed consent
2. Age \> 18 years
3. Subjects with a CF-LVAD or are scheduled to receive a CF-LVAD implant

Exclusion Criteria:

1. Psychiatric disorder or disease, irreversible cognitive dysfunction or psychosocial issues that might impair compliance with the study.
2. Patients already taking fish oil.

participantFlowModule.preAssignmentDetails: Study terminated by PI for low/no enrollment prior to primary and secondary endpoints. All efforts were taken to gather all possible data.

categories.title: Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander

measures.title: Dilated Cardiomyopathy
measures.description: Dilated cardiomyopathy is etiology of heart failure and a disease of the heart muscle of the left ventricle, specifically in its ability to dilate.

measures.title: Pre-LVAD Implant New York Heart Association Class (NYHA)
measures.description: NYHA class determines the functional status of the patient. There are classes I-IV. Class I is no symptoms and IV is symptoms at rest.

measures.title: Interagency Registry for Mechanically Assisted Circulatory Support (Intermacs)
measures.description: The Interagency Registry for Mechanically Assisted Circulatory Support (INTERMACS) identifies patients with advanced heart failure undergoing mechanical circulatory support (MCS) at risk of complications after MCS. The INTERMACS scale goes from 1-7, where INTERMACS 1 is "crash and burn" and 7 is stable at home with some symptoms.

adverseEventsModule.timeFrame: Adverse events were collected within the first year of the study.
adverseEventsModule.description:
Patients were assessed at clinic for medication compliance and self-reported medication side effects, in addition to follow-up calls for any additional medication side effects.

Study terminated by PI for low/no enrollment. All efforts were taken to gather all possible data.
